# _Sparkle: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack_

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

This article is about the soundtrack album for [the 2012
film](/wiki/Sparkle_\(2012_film\) "Sparkle \(2012 film\)"). For the soundtrack
album for [the 1976 film](/wiki/Sparkle_\(1976_film\) "Sparkle \(1976
film\)"), see [Sparkle (Aretha Franklin
album)](/wiki/Sparkle_\(Aretha_Franklin_album\) "Sparkle \(Aretha Franklin
album\)").

_**Sparkle: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack**_ is the [soundtrack
album](/wiki/Soundtrack_album "Soundtrack album") for the 2012
[Sony](/wiki/Sony_Pictures_Entertainment "Sony Pictures
Entertainment")/[TriStar Pictures](/wiki/TriStar_Pictures "TriStar Pictures")
film _[Sparkle](/wiki/Sparkle_\(2012_film\) "Sparkle \(2012 film\)")_ , a
remake of the [1976 film of the same name](/wiki/Sparkle_\(1976_film\)
"Sparkle \(1976 film\)"). The album was released through [Sony Music
Entertainment](/wiki/Sony_Music_Entertainment "Sony Music Entertainment")'s
[RCA Records](/wiki/RCA_Records "RCA Records") on July 31, 2012. The film's
soundtrack includes new recordings of four songs from the [original film's
soundtrack](/wiki/Sparkle_\(Aretha_Franklin_album\) "Sparkle \(Aretha Franklin
album\)") as well as new original music by [Jordin Sparks](/wiki/Jordin_Sparks
"Jordin Sparks"), [Whitney Houston](/wiki/Whitney_Houston "Whitney Houston")
and [Cee Lo Green](/wiki/Cee_Lo_Green "Cee Lo Green"). The soundtrack's first
official lead single is the last song recorded by Whitney Houston before she
died on February 11, 2012, a duet with [R&B](/wiki/Rhythm_and_blues "Rhythm
and blues")/[pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop music") [singer](/wiki/Singing
"Singing") and _[American Idol](/wiki/American_Idol "American Idol")_ winner
[Jordin Sparks](/wiki/Jordin_Sparks "Jordin Sparks") on a song called
"[Celebrate](/wiki/Celebrate_\(Whitney_Houston_and_Jordin_Sparks_song\)
"Celebrate \(Whitney Houston and Jordin Sparks song\)")".[2] The song
premiered on _[On Air with Ryan
Seacrest](/wiki/On_Air_with_Ryan_Seacrest_\(radio\) "On Air with Ryan Seacrest
\(radio\)")_ on May 21, 2012[3] and was made available for digital download on
iTunes on June 5.[4] Whitney Houston's other track, "[His Eye is On the
Sparrow](/wiki/His_Eye_Is_on_the_Sparrow#Whitney_Houston_version "His Eye Is
on the Sparrow")", debuted only one day after the premiere of "Celebrate".[5]
The official music video for "Celebrate" was filmed on May 30, 2012.[6] It
made its world premiere on [BET](/wiki/Black_Entertainment_Television "Black
Entertainment Television")'s _[106& Park](/wiki/106_%26_Park "106 & Park")_ on
June 27, 2012.[7]

##
Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background")]

The songs on the soundtrack are performed by the actors in the film, including
[Jordin Sparks](/wiki/Jordin_Sparks "Jordin Sparks"), [Whitney
Houston](/wiki/Whitney_Houston "Whitney Houston"), [Cee Lo
Green](/wiki/Cee_Lo_Green "Cee Lo Green"), [Carmen Ejogo](/wiki/Carmen_Ejogo
"Carmen Ejogo"), [Tika Sumpter](/wiki/Tika_Sumpter "Tika Sumpter"), and
others. _Sparkle_ features songs from the original film written by soul
musician [Curtis Mayfield](/wiki/Curtis_Mayfield "Curtis Mayfield") as well as
new compositions by R&B artist [R. Kelly](/wiki/R._Kelly "R. Kelly") and
others.[8][9] The soundtrack includes new songs not present in the 1976
version of _Sparkle_ :
"[Celebrate](/wiki/Celebrate_\(Whitney_Houston_and_Jordin_Sparks_song\)
"Celebrate \(Whitney Houston and Jordin Sparks song\)")", "[His Eye is On the
Sparrow](/wiki/His_Eye_Is_on_the_Sparrow#Whitney_Houston_version "His Eye Is
on the Sparrow")", among others. "Celebrate" was sent to radio the week of May
21, 2012 as the first official from the _Sparkle_ soundtrack. The song
premiered on _[On Air with Ryan
Seacrest](/wiki/On_Air_with_Ryan_Seacrest_\(radio\) "On Air with Ryan Seacrest
\(radio\)")_ on May 21.[3] and was made available for digital download on
iTunes on June 5.[4] Houston's other track, "His Eye is On the Sparrow",
debuted only one day after the premiere of "Celebrate".[5]

##
Composition[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Composition")]

### Music and
themes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Music and themes")]

_Sparkle: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack_ takes on matters of the
celebration, heartache, heartbreak and seduction with a mixture of ballads,
mid- and up-tempos.[10]

##
Release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Release")]

The _Sparkle: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack_ was released on July 31,
2012; though announced with 13 tracks,[11] it was released with only 11
tracks. Five days before the soundtrack's official release the entire
soundtrack was made available to stream exclusively through Sparks' Official
store and Essence.com.[12][13] Jordin Sparks, who worked closely with Houston
throughout the making of _Sparkle_ , finds the release of the soundtrack to be
"bittersweet."[14] Sparks states, "I worked with my idol and that was a dream
come true. I used to watch the _[Cinderella](/wiki/Cinderella_\(1997_film\)
"Cinderella \(1997 film\)")_ adaptation with her and
[Brandy](/wiki/Brandy_Norwood "Brandy Norwood") every day after school. But
she should really be here promoting it with me and [it's] really hard for me
to be doing it alone."[14][15]

[Allmusic](/wiki/Allmusic "Allmusic") writer Andy Kellman gave it three and a
half out of five stars and called the soundtrack "an enjoyable if muddled
affair" and commended the four songs covered on the new soundtrack stating
"the 2012 soundtrack features faithful and decent covers of four songs from
the original.[10] When it comes to "Something He Can Feel," it would be an
understatement to say that the deck is stacked against Sparks and her vocal
partners, Carmen Ejogo and Tika Sumpter." _[Entertainment
Weekly](/wiki/Entertainment_Weekly "Entertainment Weekly")_ 's Melissa Maerz
gave _Sparkle: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack_ a B rating and praised
Sparks version of "Look Into Your Heart" stating "Sparks bellows Mayfield's
power ballad _Look Into Your Heart_ with absolute conviction.[16] Jody Rosen
of _[Rolling Stone](/wiki/Rolling_Stone "Rolling Stone")_ gave the soundtrack
3Â½ of 5 stars, commenting that "Sparkle revives four soul chestnuts and
includes three originals written and produced by [R. Kelly](/wiki/R._Kelly "R.
Kelly"). It's the second-most-satisfying retro-soul album of the year â€“ after
Kelly's _[Write Me Back](/wiki/Write_Me_Back "Write Me Back")_ "; however, he
was ambivalent towards Houston's last two recordings before her passing,
saying that,
"[Celebrate](/wiki/Celebrate_\(Whitney_Houston_and_Jordin_Sparks_song\)
"Celebrate \(Whitney Houston and Jordin Sparks song\)") is forgettable
[disco](/wiki/Disco "Disco")-[pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop music"), and on the
gospel standard "[His Eye Is on the Sparrow](/wiki/His_Eye_Is_on_the_Sparrow
"His Eye Is on the Sparrow")" Houston sings â€“ and croaks â€“ in a voice octaves
lower than in her prime. At times the song has a ravaged magnificence, but
mostly it's painful."[18]

### Chart
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Chart performance")]

  * For the week ending August 18, 2012 the soundtrack debuted on the [_Billboard_ 200](/wiki/Billboard_200 "Billboard 200") at # 26, # 7 on the _Billboard_ [R&B/Hip-Hop Albums](/wiki/R%26B/Hip-Hop_Albums "R&B/Hip-Hop Albums") and # 1 on the _Billboard_ [Top Soundtracks Albums](/wiki/Billboard_charts#Albums "Billboard charts"), selling 12,000 copies in its first week. To date, the soundtrack has sold 86,000 copies.[19]

##
Singles[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Sparkle:_Original_Motion_Picture_Soundtrack&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Singles")]

"[Celebrate](/wiki/Celebrate_\(Whitney_Houston_and_Jordin_Sparks_song\)
"Celebrate \(Whitney Houston and Jordin Sparks song\)")" is the first official
single from the soundtrack. It is the last song recorded by Whitney Houston
before she died on February 11, 2012, a duet featuring her and
[R&B](/wiki/Rhythm_and_blues "Rhythm and blues")/[pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop
music") [singer](/wiki/Singing "Singing") [Jordin Sparks](/wiki/Jordin_Sparks
"Jordin Sparks"). It was officially released on June 5, 2012 for [digital
download](/wiki/Music_download "Music download") and it was written by [R.
Kelly](/wiki/R._Kelly "R. Kelly") who also produced the track. For the week
June 16, 2012, "Celebrate" debuted at number 34 on the US [Adult R&B
Airplay](/wiki/Adult_R%26B_Airplay "Adult R&B Airplay") chart, having amassed
45 spins for that week ending.[20] During that same week, "Celebrate" also
debuted at number 84 on the US [Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs](/wiki/Hot_R%26B/Hip-
Hop_Songs "Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs") chart,[21] and has since peaked at number
54.[22] The [music video](/wiki/Music_video "Music video") for "Celebrate" was
filmed on May 30, 2012.[6] A preview of the video premiered on _[Entertainment
Tonight](/wiki/Entertainment_Tonight "Entertainment Tonight")_ on June 4,
2012.[23] The music video made its world premiere on
[BET](/wiki/Black_Entertainment_Television "Black Entertainment Television")'s
_[106& Park](/wiki/106_%26_Park "106 & Park")_ on June 27, 2012.[7]

"[His Eye Is on the
Sparrow](/wiki/His_Eye_Is_on_the_Sparrow#Whitney_Houston_version "His Eye Is
on the Sparrow")" is the second official single from the soundtrack. The song
is a gospel hymn performed by Whitney Houston. Houston is seen performing the
song in a church scene in the [film trailer](/wiki/Film_trailer "Film
trailer"). The song was officially released on June 8, 2012 for digital
download from Amazon[24] and iTunes. The song was originally written in 1905
by lyricist [Civilla D. Martin](/wiki/Civilla_D._Martin "Civilla D. Martin")
and composer [Charles H. Gabriel](/wiki/Charles_H._Gabriel "Charles H.
Gabriel"). The song is most associated with actress-singer [Ethel
Waters](/wiki/Ethel_Waters "Ethel Waters") who used the title for her
autobiography.[25]
